sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Maximillian Piras)
articles.description: As Artificial Intelligence evolves the computing paradigm, designers have an opportunity to craft more intuitive user interfaces. Maximillian Piras examines how the latest AI capabilities can reshape the future of human-computer interaction beyond conversation alone.
articles.title: When Words Cannot Describe: Designing For AI Beyond Conversational Interfaces

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: With February just around the corner, how about a little inspiration boost? We might have one for you: desktop wallpapers created with love by the community for the community. Enjoy!
articles.title: 29 Days Of Inspiration (February 2024 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andy Budd)
articles.description: Most product teams commonly adopt a feature-centric mindset, finding them convenient for brainstorming, drafting requirement documents, and integrating into backlogs and ticketing systems. In this article, Andy Budd shows how fixation with features might be holding you back and how making a few small tweaks to your process could make an entire world of difference.
articles.title: The Feature Trap: Why Feature Centricity Is Harming Your Product

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Joas Pambou)
articles.description: Language models have shown impressive capabilities. But that doesn’t mean they’re without faults, as anyone who has witnessed a ChatGPT “hallucination” can attest. In this article, Joas Pambou diagnoses the symptoms that cause hallucinations and explains not only what RAG is but also different approaches for using it to solve language model limitations.
articles.title: A Simple Guide To Retrieval Augmented Generation Language Models

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Yair Even Or)
articles.description: Taking inspiration from shadows, author Yair Even Or creates the same sort of thing, only with a blurring effect in place of the shadow. Read along for a step-by-step explanation of how it comes together using a combination of masks, gradients, and the good ol’ `backdrop-filter` property.
articles.title: CSS Blurry Shimmer Effect

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Filip Paldia & Jamie Clarke)
articles.description: AI promises a major upheaval in typography, with designers finding themselves navigating both opportunities and challenges. How will it impact quality, design roles, and our use of type in the future? As we explore this new frontier, we realise that we are at a juncture as significant as Gutenberg’s press, set to redefine how we interact with text and visual communication.
articles.title: The AI Dilemma In Graphic Design: Steering Towards Excellence In Typography And Beyond

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Temani Afif)
articles.description: The CSS `border-image` property is one of those properties you undoubtedly know exists but may not have ever reached for. In this article, Temani Afif demonstrates different approaches for using `border-image` to create clever decorative accents and shapes.
articles.title: The Complex But Awesome CSS border-image Property

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Louis Lazaris)
articles.description: Useful front-end tools for CSS and JavaScript developers that were most popular last year and will help you speed up your development workflow. Let’s dive in!
articles.title: Top Front-End Tools Of 2023

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Atila Fassina)
articles.description: Are you ready for a little exercise of pulling a framework apart and putting the pieces back together? In this article, Atila Fassina explains how meta-frameworks have evolved around core libraries in their own unique ways.
articles.title: SolidStart: A Different Breed Of Meta-Framework

articles.author: Reed Barger
articles.description: If you're building applications with React, you should learn how to use some helpful libraries that'll make it easier to add the features you need. For example, to add features like authentication or styling, you'll need to find a good third-party library to handle it. In this comprehensive guide, I'm
articles.title: React Libraries to Use in Your Projects in 2024

articles.author: Kedar Makode
articles.description: The boot process is made up of a series of necessary actions that a computer goes through upon startup. These range from powering on to the complete loading of the operating system (OS) for optimal functionality.  It is vital to familiarize yourself with the boot process for various reasons.
articles.title: Linux Boot Process – What Happens when Booting RHEL

articles.author: Matéush
articles.description: Everyone wants to be able to access the web from their mobile phones these days. So it's important to consider the accessibility of your web app on Android and iPhones.  The most difficult part is building the navigation – and swiping in particular can cause a lot of headaches.
articles.title: How to Build a Mobile Swiping Component in React

articles.author: Quincy Larson
articles.description: In this week's episode of the podcast, I interview Robby Russell. Robby created the open-source project Oh My ZSH.  Oh My Zsh is a framework for managing your Zsh configuration for your command line terminal. It's been extremely popular among developers for more than a decade. Robby is
articles.title: Podcast: Oh My Zsh creator and Dev Shop CEO Robby Russell

articles.author: Musab Habeeb
articles.description: All programming languages have runtime engines that execute their code. In JavaScript, the runtime engine is single-threaded, which means that it runs code line by line or sequentially. The JavaScript runtime engine makes it a synchronous programming language where programs run sequentially. Programming languages that are not synchronous are called
articles.title: Asynchronous Programming in JavaScript – Callbacks, Promises, & Async/Await Examples

articles.author: Manish Shivanandhan
articles.description: Fast.ai is a user-friendly library that brings the power of deep learning to your fingertips, regardless of your skill level. Let’s learn how it works. Have you ever felt curious about deep learning but found the technical complexity overwhelming? Fast.ai [https://fast.ai/] is your answer. Fast.ai simplifies the journey into deep
articles.title: How to Use Fast.ai – A Beginner-Friendly Gateway to Deep Learning

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Ensuring that web content is accessible to everyone, including people with disabilities, is not just a noble goal—it's a necessity. We just published a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you all about web accessibility. This course is designed to empower developers with the knowledge and skills
articles.title: How to Make Your Web Sites Accessible

articles.author: Tantoluwa Heritage Alabi
articles.description: JavaScript arrays are fundamental data structures that allow you to store and manipulate collections of elements efficiently. While working with arrays, you'll often need to know their length. The length of an array tells us how many elements are present in the array. You can use this to check if
articles.title: JavaScript Array Length – How to Find the Length of an Array in JS

articles.author: Rajdeep Singh
articles.description: Good project documentation is key to success for every company, startup, or individual project. Without documentation, it's much harder for new developers or others to use your project. In this article, I'll discuss some of my favourite libraries you can use for building your documentation site.  And don't worry
articles.title: Documentation Libraries to Help You Write Good Docs

articles.author: Sahil Mahapatra
articles.description: Shadcn is a collection of beautifully designed, accessible, and customizable React components that you can use to build modern web applications with Next.js. With Shadcn, you can quickly and easily create user interfaces that are both stylish and functional. If you are looking for a way to build modern, stylish,
articles.title: How to Use Shadcn with Next.js 14
